metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15098 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Invalid json_populate_recordset or jsonb_populate_recordset function calls in PostgreSQL 10.x before 10.1, 9.6.x before 9.6.6, 9.5.x before 9.5.10, 9.4.x before 9.4.15, and 9.3.x before 9.3.20 can crash the server or disclose a few bytes of server memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.1-1
libecpg6 - 10.1-1
libpgtypes3 - 10.1-1
libpq5 - 10.1-1
postgresql-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.1-1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.1-1').
